query: When A and C are poured into D, what happens next?

original_scene.description: A is water held in a metal container. B is five bottles of purple, red, green, blue and yellow dye. C is oil contained in a small cup. D is a set of six same test tubes.

key_step_1.conclusion: Pour equal amounts of A into D, then pour B into D respectively and stir thoroughly.Since A and C are both transparent and difficult to distinguish, B and A are mixed to make it easier to distinguish A and C.

key_step_2.conclusion: Pour equal amounts of C into D.Since the molecular sizes of A and C are different, they will not mix. In addition, since the density of A is greater than that of C, C is located on top of A.

key_step_3.conclusion: Take one from D, plug the mouth and turn it over. Due to the difference in molecular size and density, A and C remain separated from each other and C is above A.

final_scene.annotation: A and C are separated and C is above A.

subject: mechanics
